Name: Allow Modded Achievements
Author: Xenofell
About: Enables achievements when mods are enabled.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed crash when loading a save that has already been flagged as modded.

Description:
[b]Allow Modded Achievements[/b]

By default, modded games may not get achievements and their saved games are flagged as being modded. This mod disables the mod tracking functionality so you can gain achievements again.

There are many quality of life mods that do not impact balance which should not block achievements. Please do not use this mod to cheat.

[b]How to install[/b]

0. Download the latest published zip file.
1. Install[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21] UnityModManager[/url]
2. Install the zip with UnityModManager.

[b]Links[/b]

Source code: [url=https://github.com/cstamford/WOTR_AllowModdedAchievements]https://github.com/cstamford/WOTR_AllowModdedAchievements[/url]

Description:
[b]Imagine if setting up an auto buffing mod was easy enough you don't need a PhD, and integrated enough you don't need to open a UMM gui to configure it?





WANT TO LAUGH AT CODE?????

[url=https://github.com/factubsio/BubbleBuffs]factubsio/BubbleBuffs: Bubbles Ultimate Buff Bot Lite Extra Simple (BUBBLES) (github.com)[/url][/b]




Items/Consumables are [b]not[/b] implemented yet.



[center][size=6][b][font=Comic Sans MS]GAME VERSION 1.1 => MOD VERSION 2.X.X
GAME VERSION 1.2 => MOD VERSION 3.X.X

[/font][/b][/size]I am not currently supporting older game versions, go look through the archived files and see if any work but don't file bugs against them.[/center]
[size=5]HOW TO USE:
[/size]
(also see the images for help)

While [b]not[/b] on the global map and [b]not[/b] in Drezen/camp, or anywhere where you have your full party:

Go to the Spellbook tab.
Click "Buff Setup" at the lower right
Select spells or abilities (Items and Consumables are [b]not[/b] implemented yet).
Select the spell/ability you want to cast
Click on each party member at the bottom to toggle casting on them:
  * gray: do not cast
  * green: cast (available casters)
  * yellow: cast (no available casters)
  * red: invalid target (e.g. personal spells, or animal-growth on a human, etc).
You can customise caster behaviour with the little "up" arrow above the caster's portrait (not the target portrait).

Close the spellbook
Click the "buff" button on the lower left of the screen.

optional: Check the results in the combat log

[size=5]Files:
[/size]
[size=2]Settings are stored in the UserSettings folder under the mod, in a file called bubblebuff-GAME_ID.json where GAME_ID is the guid of your playthrough. Feel free to look through and edit it but expect things to crash if you do wonky stuff like to turn on Powerful Change on for a druid, or try to get someone to cast a spell they don't have.
[/size]
[size=5]For Skidmarcanists:[/size]

If you are an arcanist and casting an appropriate spell you can toggle "Allow Share Transmutation" and "Use Powerful Change". The mod [b]will[/b] spend the points from your arcane resevoir but does not (currently) predict them like it does spell slots.

If you are using Share Transmutation and there are no points, the spell will be skipped.
If you are using Powerful Change and there are no points, the spell will be cast without it.

[b]NOTE: The combat log will say these casts are successful, it is a known thing and will get fixed eventually.[/b]

Thanks to DeadMor0z for the contributions!

Name: Enhanced Inventory
Author: Xenofell
About: Enhances the inventory with features such as: a search bar for inventory, stores, and the spellbook; more filtering and sorting options, customizable filter and sort lists; highlighting important loot. Does not affect gameplay. Configurable through the UMM mod options screen.

VersionHistory.Changelog: - 1.2.0 compatibility patch. Fixed the spellbook functionality not working after the recent patch.

- Added chinese localization. (thanks RomancingSaGa4)
- Bugfix: Fixed sorter dropdown breaking on the vendor screen after the first time opening the vendor screen in an area.
- Bugfix: The search bar now updates correctly with each letter typed. Whoops!

Only download it if you are playing on 1.1.0 or later.

- Bugfix: Fixed the various inventory screens resetting to the top of the screen when making changes (e.g. equipping or selling an item).

1.1.0 compatibility patch. Please note that this release is not compatible with older versions. Only download it if you are playing on 1.1.0 or later.

- Bugfix: Fixed the spell buttons on the spellbook being misaligned if you had unlocked level 10 spells. (the bar should grow from the left now)
- Bugfix: Minor mod compatibility changes.

1.0.8d compatibility patch! (and one bonus feature)

- _New feature_: Added a new toggle to the Collect All filtering option to collect all notable items (items with golden borders).
- _Bugfix_: After the release of the recent patch which added 10th level spells to the game, selecting 10th level spells in the spellbook would display metamagic spells and selecting metamagic spells would display nothing. This has now been fixed.

- New feature: Added an option to tweak the behaviour of the Collect All button on the loot window. (default off) This option is fully configurable - make sure to enable and configure via the mod options menu!
-- Collect all zero weight items. Any item which has a zero weight will be collected using the Collect All button.
-- Collect all unidentified items. Items which are not identified will be collected using the Collect All button.
-- Collect all useful items. Unlearned scrolls and recipes and unread books will be collected using the Collect All button.
-- Collect all items that pass a price divided by weight cutoff. The default value is 10, meaning that an item of value 10 and weight 1 would be looted, but the same item with a weight of 2 would not be. 
- New feature: Added a new filter to the inventory,  'gear for the selected character'. This filter will only show items with the same weapon, shield, and armour types as the selected character. Very useful for quickly scanning through all of your characters to pick out quick upgrades!
- New feature: Added a new filter to the inventory, 'non-zero price and weight'. This filter will only display items with a value AND a weight above 0. Very useful to cut down on unsellable items when combined with the price / weight sorter. 
- New feature: Added an option to preventing switching to the metamagic tab after creating a new metamagic spell. This is helpful when you want to create more than one metamagic spell at the same time. (default on)
- Change: Fixed the search bar background text when you open the inventory for the first time; it will properly display the dropdown option now.
- Change: The spell filtering by save options should now work for users on non-English localizations.
- Change: Some options have been relabelled to make their purpose clearer.

https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/3662/images/137/137-1632747192-1784142739.png

- New feature: Added a Learn All Scrolls button to the spellbook UI. If you have any learnable scrolls in your inventory that the selected character can use, one click of this button will automatically learn them for you!
- New feature: Added an 'all unlearned spells' checkbox to the spellbook UI; this will show all unlearned spells (even ones you don't already know) that match your selected searching criteria. This is handy for e.g. showing every spell you could possibly get and filtering by school or save to plan your future spells.
- New feature: Added an option to show the spell level next to the spell icon when viewing all spell levels. (default on)
- New feature: Added an option to hide the little grey metamagic circles above spells (default hidden), which can be very noisy when you have many metamagic feats.
- Change: The all button has moved to a checkbox at the bottom right; this clears up user confusion, since it was not obvious the button was toggleable separately to the spell levels.
- Change: Show all spells is now off by default. Big spellbooks can be quite slow to load, and it creates a better user experience if it is opt in.
- Change: Changing spell levels while the all button is active will no longer trigger a complete spellbook refresh. This is helpful when you're trying to fill your spellbook up level by level while using the all spells view.
- Change: The spell list will now reset its scroll to the top in appropriate circumstances, e.g. when toggling between spell levels or applying the various spell search and filtering options.
- Change: Options text updated to make it more clear how to disable certain aspects of the mod (spellbook changes, inventory changes, etc).
- Change: The spell level buttons have been relocated to the left, snug with the search bar; on some characters (wizards with a specialized school) the buttons would overlap with the school graphics and be hard to click.

- Feature: Spellbook searching mk. 2. First iteration was clumsy to use when you wanted to go through each spell level, so a new solution has been devised! The spell level buttons are back. In addition, there is an "all" button. When this button is selected (default on, configurable in options), all your spells will be shown, regardless of selected level. When it is off, only the selected level will be shown.
- Feature: Added a toggle on the spellbook screen to show or hide metamagic. (default on, configurable in options)
- Enhancement: The dropdown icon is now hidden.
- Enhancement: Updated the options text for the hybrid mode of inventory search bar and removed the experimental text.
- Fixed: The Inventory search bar now has the correct icon on the dropdown when opening the inventory for the first time.
- Fixed: When using the hybrid inventory search bar mode, fixed a bug which resulted in the dropdown options on the search bar having no effect. Also, the old category button now updates to reflect the chosen dropdown option.
- Fixed: The spellbook now properly refreshes when metamagic is written or deleted.

https://youtu.be/7EznhS01sIs

- New feature: Spellbook searching; users can now search the spellbook for spells. All spells are visible by default. Spells can be filtered by spell level or other categories such as saving throw. Searching operates on the name, saving throws, and school by default, and the description can be toggled in the mod options. Clicking on a spell will select that spell memorisation level on the left of the screen. Please note this is the first iteration, there is plenty to improve, including performance!
- New feature: Sorting by type now sorts also by subtype alphabetically, e.g. longswords will come after daggers.
- Enhancement: The scrollbar now resets to the top when pressing enter to complete an inventory search. (tweakable via mod options)
- Enhancement: The search bar now has focus when opening the inventory screen. (tweakable via mod options)
- Fixed: In some circumstances, when looting, a bunch of exceptions could spam the log file.
- Fixed: Users can configure the searching categories (e.g. searching item description) once more.
- Fixed: If the search bar was disabled but the user had tweaked their visible filters, bad things would happen, but no more!

Description: Enhances the inventory experience. Adds features such as: a search bar to all inventory screens, additional filtering and sorting options, customizable filter and sort lists, highlight important loot in the loot window. Options are highly configurable through the UMM mod options screen.

Name: More Bulk Sell
Author: zesen
About: Enables more items to be sold in bulk. Now you can sell all those Longsword 1's and Leather Armor +2's with the click of a button.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Compatibility update for game version 1.3.0k.

Fixed logic of selling accessories like belts and necklaces.
Can now sell bracers of lesser archery, amulets of agile and mighty fists.

Known issue: there is no way to prevent normal weapons (no enchantments, nothing) from being sold when using the mod. Work around: disable the mod if you need this functionality. You can prevent non-enchanted cold-iron weapons from being sold by disabling cold iron by clicking "more options" under the weapon mod menu (ctrl + F10).
Cold iron and masterwork weapons were not being sold (enchanted or not) - fixed.
Unique item detection might have been previously localization dependent, making the mod not work for some languages when this option was not disabled, this should now be fixed.
Masterwork weapons were being sold even when this option was not selected - fixed.

Improved item selection for everything except weapons, armors and shields. Will improve those further in a future patch.
Now can bulk sell common bracers of armor.
New option to toggle selling of scrolls and potions.
New button to set enhancement bonus for all items. This might be useful when all your items are +2, and you can switch to selling +1 items with a single click.
The mod can now properly be enabled/disabled in the UMM menu.

Improved unique item selection.
Fixed bug in weapon/armor/shield enhancement levels.
Fixed bug where weapon physical material types were ignored (now you can exclude weapon material types such as adamantine).
Added options for more item types: belts, necklaces, head pieces, cloaks and rings.
Fixed settings not being able to be saved.

Added more options for fine tuning which enchanted weapons will be sold (by default all enchantments are marked for being sold). Can also bulk sell ingredients now (do not set stack size for these to 0 though, check known issues).

You can now specify a minimum amount of items to be left in your inventory (credit to timitin for the idea). Also added basic support for scrolls and potions (not possible to select potion types, but can select an upper bound so the excess will be sold).

Description:
[b]Summary[/b]

You can now choose more items to be sold when you click the "Bulk Sell" button during a trade.

The item choices are done through the mod options (default ctrl+F10, and click on the mod). The item choices are not shown in the regular bulk sell item selection menu (as I do not really know how to add the options there in a good way).

Example: If you select "+3" for weapons, all [i][b]common[/b][/i] weapons with an enchantment level of +3 and lower will be moved to be sold. Items marked as "notable" are never moved. Items that have a unique name are also not moved, unless you pick the option in the mod menu. Even with this option, items marked "notable" by the game are never moved to be sold. You can also toggle enchantment types such as Shock, Cold Iron etc. for weapons, planning to add similar options to other items.

[b]Important: [/b]Make sure to always double check the items that are about to be sold!

[b]Full changelog[/b][b] can be found under the [/b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/163?tab=logs]logs[/url][b]﻿ tab.[/b]

[b]Update 0.4.4: [/b]Compatibility update for game version 1.3.0k.
[b]Update 0.4.3:[/b] 
[list]
[*]Fixed some unique accessories being moved for bulk selling.
[*]More accessories can now be sold: amulets of mighty fists, amulets of agile firsts, bracers of lesser archery. These all use the same enchantment level for their accessory type item (e.g., setting necklaces to +2 will sell both amulets of natural armor +2, and amulet of mighty fists +2). 
[/list]

Feedback and bug reports are welcome!
[b]
[/b]

[b]Installation

[/b][list=1]
[*]Install the latest version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21/]Unity Mod Manager[/url] (UMM), and set it up for Pathfinder: WotR[b].[/b]
[*]Manually download the mod archive (.zip), and install it through UMM. You can simply drag & drop the archive to the box in UMM.
[/list]
You are set! The game should show the installed mods at the main menu.

Note that using mods disables Steam achievements. You can re-enable them with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/119]this mod[/url]﻿ (at least at the time of writing this).

[b]
Other Information[/b]

The mod does not change any game files and does a very minor patch, so it should be compatible with almost any other mod. That being said, use it at your own risk.

[b]
Known issues[/b]

See bug reports for known issues and other known bugs. You are welcome to submit bug reports as well if it doesn't already exist!

[b]
Credit

[/b]Some of the mods and tools I use during development, and which I am thankful for:
[list]
[*][b][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/9]﻿Data Viewer[/url]﻿﻿[/b] and [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/8]Toy Box [/url]﻿by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/2570756]Cabarius[/url], which are immensely helpful in understanding the internals of items, blueprints and enchantments, as well as adding items for testing!
[*][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/137]Enhanced Inventory[/url] by [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/114484113]Xenofell[/url]﻿, not only for its usefulness in game, but also some inspirations from its great source code for a new modder!
[/list]

Name: More Relic Info
Author: zesen
About: A simple mod to show all possible items from the very first relic project card. No more wasting time on relic projects hoping you will get some useful item in the end! Also has an option to disable automatic pop-ups of completed projects in kingdom management (the option is disabled by default).

VersionHistory.Changelog: Patch compatibility with 1.3.0k.
Initial version.

Description:
[b]Summary[/b]

A simple mod to show possible items from the very first relic project card. No more wasting time on relic projects hoping you will get some useful item in the end, now you can see all options from the very beginning!

Also has an option to disable automatic pop-ups of completed projects in kingdom management (disabled by default, can be enabled from the UMM mod menu,  default ctrl+F10). This was added to address a bug in 1.1 beta, which prevented the game from progressing.

[b]Important notice: [/b]This mod sometimes disables relic card texts after a game patch, and it needs to be built against the new binaries each time. If you already have the Toy Box mod, this mod was integrated into it some time ago, and that mod is probably getting more regular updates than I can provide; so I recommend enabling relic information from there if you are already using it. Still, I will try to post updates to this mod when I can.

[b]Updates[/b]
[b]0.2.2[/b]
- Patch compatibility with 1.3.0k.
[b] 0.2.1[/b]
- Patch compatibility with 1.1.0k - relic cards were missing their text when opened.

[b]Installation[/b]

[list=1]
[*]Install the latest version of [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21/]Unity Mod Manager[/url] (UMM), and set it up for Pathfinder: WotR[b].[/b]
[*]Manually download the mod archive (.zip), and install it through UMM. You can simply drag & drop the archive to the box in UMM.
[/list]
You are set! The game should show the installed mods at the main menu.

Note that using mods disables Steam achievements. You can re-enable them with [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/mods/119]this mod[/url]﻿ (at least at the time of writing this).

[b]
Other Information[/b]

The mod does not change any files, so it should be compatible with most other mods and should not mess with your save games. That being said, use it at your own risk.

Although I try my best to avoid bugs, and the changes are quite simple, they might still exist... All bug reports and constructive feedback are welcome!

Source files are in the files section.

[b]Kudos[/b]
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/943197]TheLich[/url] for providing an updated version of the mod while I was away.
- [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/pathfinderwrathoftherighteous/users/37868990]SirMadjesty[/url] for checking compatibility with one of the patches.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
How to Install

Download and install Unity Mod Manager, make sure it is at least version 0.23.0
Run Unity Mod Manger and set it up to find Wrath of the Righteous
Download the WOTR_PATH_OF_RAGE mod
Install the mod by dragging the zip file from step 3 into the Unity Mod Manager window under the Mods tab

Changes in this version:
* Spell Damage Dice Progression is changed to work as written. In addition, if an enemy has any energy vulnerability they'll be vulnerable to the attack at mythic rank 10.
* The golden dragon breath is now a move action instead of a standard and will scale damage off of your full mythic rank. Cooldown is negated when transformed into your gold dragon form.
* The golden dragon breath's debuff will now stack.
* Gives a unique icon to the Gold Dragon Form.
* Gives the Gold Dragon Form a mythic bonus of plus two to all mental stats.
* Gives a Gold Dragon a divine spontaneous spellbook.

Name: Tabletop Tweaks Base
Author: Vek17
About: Adds tabletop based fixes and new content. Once a game is saved with this mod enabled it requires this mod to load, so do not uninstall it. You can disable any feature of the mod without breaking saves.

VersionHistory.Changelog:
## Version 2.4.0
* Release for 2.0.0
* Fixes
    * Fixed broken charge mechanics
    * Sohei
        * Sohei should now work correctly with weapon training changes if enabled
    * Winter Witch
        * Unearly Cold's direct damage should now properly respect metamagic and added bonus damage
* Added Metamagic
	* Elemental Spell Metamagic
		* Choose one energy type: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You may replace a spell’s normal damage with that energy type "or split the spell’s damage, so that half is of that energy type and half is of its normal type.
Fix for 1.4.4g

## Version 2.3.1
* Release for 1.4.0

**THIS IS THE FOR 1.4.0 BETA ONLY**

## Version 2.3.0
* Fixes
    * Witch
        * Fixed Cauldren Witch incorrectly scaling with character level instead of witch level.
* Added Content
    * Rogue Talents
        * Bleeding Attack
            * A rogue with this ability can cause living opponents to bleed by hitting them with a sneak attack. This attack causes the target to take 1 additional point of damage each round for each die of the rogue’s sneak attack.
        * Emboldening Strike
            * When a rogue with this talent hits a creature with a melee attack that deals sneak attack damage, she gains a +1 circumstance bonus on saving throws for every 2 sneak attack dice rolled (minimum +1) for 1 round.
    * Spells
        * Mage's Disjunction
            * All magical effects and magic items within the radius of the spell, except for those that you carry or touch, are disjoined. That is, spells and spell-like effects are unraveled and destroyed completely (ending the effect as a dispel magic spell does), and each permanent magic item must make a successful Will save or be turned into a normal item for the duration of this spell.

## Version 2.2.3
* Fixes
    * Fixed issue where Bloodline Ascendance was not selectable when it should have been.

## Version 2.2.1
* Fixes
    * Fixed broken config options for some metamagic.
    * Improved mod compatibility with metamagics.
    * Fixed mod compatibility issue with world crawl.

## Version 2.2.1
* Fixes
    * Fixed issue where vivisectionist was unselectable with alternate capstones enabled.

## Version 2.2.0
* Fixes
    * Systems
        * Progressions no longer display features you will not get.
        * Scoll UMD DCs are now calculated correctly at 20 + Scroll CL instead of 20 + Scroll spell level.
    * Features
        * Mongrol's Blessing
            * Now properly applies negative levels.
        * Incorporeal Charm
            * Now properly updates when charisma changes.
    * Spells
        * Absolute Order
            * Now has missing compulsion descriptor.
        * Command
            * Now has missing compulsion descriptor.
        * Greater Command
            * Now has missing compulsion descriptor.
        * Legendary Proportions
            * Now only increases size by one step instead of two.
        * Power From Death
            * Now correctly lasts rounds per level instead of minutes per level.
    * Feats
        * Outflank
            * Outflank should no longer triggers on missed attacks.
        * Seize the Moment
            * Seize the moment should no longer trigger on missed attacks.
        * Cleaving Finish
            * Cleave fixes now includes a working cleaving finish that will not randomly stop after three targets.
    * Alchemist
        * Fixed Thick Fog being an illusion based concealment instead of fog based.
        * Fixed issue where Abundant Incense was not selectable if you had expanded range incense.
    * Monk
        * Scaled Fist
            * Draconic Fury now uses the correct unchained version of the progression instead of the chained.
            * Fixes stunning fist to use the same version as other monks for compatibility.
    * Weapons
        * Sound of Void
            * Now correctly removes spell resistance when hitting a flat footed target.
        * Music of Death
            * Now correctly deals bonus damage when hitting a flat footed target.
* Added Content
    * Skald
        * Spell Kenning has been implemented.
    * Monk
        * Stunning Fist: Stagger
            * This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it makes the target staggered for 1d6 + 1 rounds on a failed save instead of stunning for 1 round.
        * Stunning Fist: Blind
            * This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it permanently blinds the target on a failed save instead of stunning for 1 round.
        * Stunning Fist: Paralyze
            * This ability works as Stunning Fist, but it paralyzes the target for 1d6 + 1 rounds on a failed save instead of stunning for 1 round.
    * Alternate Capstones
        * Generic Capstones
            * Perfect Body, Flawless Mind
                * The character increases her ability scores by a collective total of 8.
            * Great Beast
                * The animal companion’s Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, and Wisdom scores each increase by 4. This capstone is available to any class with an animal companion.
            * Old Dog, New Tricks
                * The character gains four combat feats. This capstone is available to characters of any class that gains at least four bonus combat feats.
        * Alchemist
            * Vast Explosions
                * The alchemist’s bomb damage increases by 3d6.
        * Arcanist
            * Deep Reservoir
                * Her arcane reservoir increases by 10.
        * Barbarian
            * Unstoppable
                * The barbarian gains DR 3/— or increases the value of any existing damage reduction by 3. In addition, she gains 20 energy resistance to acid, cold, electricity, and fire.
        * Cleric
            * Proxy
                * She can select an additional domain from the list offered by her deity.
        * Fighter
            * Veteran of Endless War
                * The bonuses granted by his armor training and weapon training increase by 2 each.
        * Inquisitor
            * Team Leader
                * As a standard action the inquisitor can spend a standard action granting characters up to three of the inquisitor’s teamwork feats (the inquisitor’s choice) as bonus feats for the next 24 hours.
        * Kineticist
            * Unbridled Power
                * Her damage with her blasts increases by 2d6+2 (for physical blasts) or by 2d6 (for energy blasts).
        * Monk
            * Old Master
                * The monk gains one additional attack at his highest base attack bonus when using flurry of blows, and he gains a dodge bonus to AC of 2.
        * Oracle
            * Diverse Mysteries
                * The oracle can select two revelations from another mystery. She must meet the prerequisites for these revelations.
        * Ranger
            * Seen It Before
                * The ranger adds his favored enemy bonus as an insight bonus on saves against spells and abilities used by his favored enemies.
        * Rogue
            * Masterful Talent
                * The rogue gains a +4 bonus on all of her skills.
        * Skald
            * Great Kenning
                * The skald can use spell kenning three additional times per day and can select one additional spell list from which he can cast spells with spell kenning.
        * Slayer
            * Against the Odds
                * When the slayer uses studied target, he can study up to two additional foes within 30 feet in the same action.
        * Warpriest
            * Hammer of God
                * The warpriest gains two additional blessings from the list offered by his deity. He can also call upon his blessings two more times each day.
        * Wizard
            * Well-Prepared
                * The wizard gains six additional 1st- and 2nd-level spell slots, four additional 3rd- and 4th-level spell slots, two additional 5th-level spell slots, and one additional 6th-level spell slot.
    * Feats
        * Ability Focus - Stunning Fist
            * Add +2 to the DC for all saving throws against your stunning fist.
        * Expanded Spell Kenning
            * When you use your spell kenning class feature, you can select a spell from either the druid or the witch spell list.
        * Mantis Style
            * You gain one additional Stunning Fist attempt per day. While using this style, you gain a +2 bonus to the DC of effects you deliver with your Stunning Fist.
        * Mantis Wisdom
            * Treat half your levels in classes other than monk as monk levels for determining effects you can apply to a target of your Stunning Fist per the Stunning Fist monk class feature. While using Mantis Style, you gain a +2 bonus on unarmed attack rolls with which you are using Stunning Fist attempts.
        * Mantis Torment
            * While using Mantis Style, you make an unarmed attack that expends two daily attempts of your Stunning Fist. If you hit, your opponent must succeed at a saving throw against your Stunning Fist or become dazzled and staggered with crippling pain until the start of your next turn, and at that point the opponent becomes fatigued.
    * Mythic Abilities
        * Abundant Spell Kenning.
            * You can use Spell Kenning a number of additional times per day equal to one third your mythic rank.

## Version 2.1.1
* Fixes
    * Hotfix for immortal mythic enemies.

## Version 2.1.0
* Fixes
    * Systems
        * Fixed Concealment checks for invisibility.
        * Size shifts are now supported from Fine to Colossal.
        * Charge damage multipliers should now work correctly again.
        * Prebuffs will be applied at a more correct level instead of nearly always CL 20.
        * Saves will now properly remember who cast buffs which should fix several bugs including idealize discovery not working on save load.
    * Feats
        * Cleave
            * Cleave now checks for adjacency to the last target (Adjacent = within 5ft) instead of just reach.
        * Cleaving Finish
            * Cleaving Finish now checks for adjacency to the last target (Adjacent = within 5ft) instead of just reach.
        * Toppling Bash
            * Toppling Bash's action cost has been removed for now due to bugs breaking action econemy when toggled. This is still limited to once per round.
    * Spells
        * Animal Growth
            * Animal Growth should now work correctly with animal companions.
        * Corrupt Magic
            * Corrupt Magic now uses a single dispel roll for all buffs like other dispels.
        * Death Ward
            * Death Ward now Suppresses existing negative levels.
        * Mind Blank
            * Mind blank now makes you immune to detection with divination effects like see invisibility and true seeing.
        * Zero State
            * Zero State now uses a single dispel roll for all buffs like other dispels.
    * Armor
        * Singing Steel
            * Singing Steel now works.
    * Equipment
        * Flawless Belt Of Physical Perfection 8
            * Now increases critical hit range by 1 in all cases.
            * Now appears as a DLC1 reward.
    * Alchemist
        * Fixed Incense Fog scaling incorrectly if you took expanded area.
    * Cavalier
        * Order of the Star's Calling ability should now properly apply bonuses.
    * Hunter
        * Fixed Divine Hunter's animal companion getting unlimited smites.
    * Rogue
        * Dispelling Attack now uses the correct CL and no longer removes debuffs.
* Added Mythic Feats
	* Cleave (Mythic)
		* Whenever you use Cleave or Cleaving Finish, your attacks can be made against a foe that is within your reach.

Description: Tabletop Tweaks is a mod that seeks to adjust the cRPG rules to more closely follow the tabletop ruleset. Additionally it adds content missing from the base game.

Name: Tabletop Tweaks Core
Author: Vek17
About: Provides a shared core system for all TabletopTweaks mods, and and any third party mods wishing to use TabletopTweaks systems and utilities.

		* Should now calculate values correctly using the correct enhancement cap.

* New Actions
	* ContextActionCleaveAttack 
		* Supports adjacency checking from the current target with a mythic override.
	* AbilityCustomCleaveTTT 
		* Supports adjacency checking from the current target with a mythic override.

* New Components
	* ChangeUnitBaseSize
		* Support for base size changes that stack with existing size changes.
	* AddMythicSpellbook
		* Supports adding standalone mythic spellbooks with a CL defined by a context value.
	* IncreaseActivatableAbilitySpeed
		* Supports altering command speed of activatable abiltiies.
	* ContextConditionCasterHasResource
		* Supports checking a resource on the caster.
	* AddIncomingDamageBonus
		* Supports adding a damage bonus to incoming attacks with a specific modifier.
	* AddFlatCriticalRangeIncrease
		* Supports critical range increases that are not multiplied by improved critical.
	* AddIncomingDamageBonus
		* Supports incoming typed damage bonuses applied as a debuff.
	* ContextConditionCasterHasResource 
		* Condition that checks that a unit has the specified resource in the specified amount.
	* IncreaseCriticalRange 
		* Supports critical range increases which are not tied to a specific weapon.
	* EnduringSpellsTTT 
		* Supports configuring thresholds for both Enduring and Greater Enduring.
	* TricksterLoreNatureRestLootTriggerTTT
		* Rest trigger for Trickster World 3 mechanics in the Trickster Rework.
	* TricksterParryTTT 
		* Reimplementation of trickster parry to catch all typs of attacks.	

* New Mechanics Features
	* BypassSneakAttackImmunity
		* Fully implemented for use. Allows the bypassing of sneak attack and precision damage immunity.
	
* New Events
	* IActivatableAbilityGetCommandTypeHandler
		* Allows the altering of activatable ability command types at run time arbitrarily.
	* ICriticalRangeCalculatedHandler 
		* Allows the altering of critical ranges without interacting with improved critical.

Additionally, when you successfully demoralize an enemy they take an additional penalty to their attack and damage rolls equal to 1 + half your mythic rank.

Description:
[b]Now with 400+ Cheats, Tweaks and Quality of Life Improvements including ability for any gender to romance any love interest

[/b][list]
[*]Bag of Tricks: 113 (or 144 depending on how you count)
[*]Level Up & Multiclass: 57
[*]Party Editor: 67
[*]Loot Coloring & Checklist: 4
[*]Enchantment: 20 ways to view add, remove enchantments from your favorite items
[*]Search 'n Pick: 75 ways to view, add, remove blueprints plus a fun global teleportation feature
[*]Crusade: 36
[*]Armies: 4
[*]Etudes: 6225 x 3 (start, unstart, complete)
[*]Quest Resolution: 1
[/list]

[b]Please backup early and backup often.[/b]

[b]Important: Make sure you are on the latest version of the game 1.09c or 1.1.0[/b]

[b]Install & Setup[/b]
[list=1]
[*]Install the [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/site/mods/21/?tab=files]Unity Mod Manager﻿[/url]﻿.
[*]Install the mod using the Unity Mod Manager﻿ or extract the archive to your game's mod folder (e.g. '\Steam\steamapps\common\Pathfinder Second Adventure\Mods').
[*]Start the game and load a save or start a new save (the mod's functions can't accessed from the main menu).
[*]Open the Unity Mod Manager﻿ by pressing CTRL + F10.
[*]Adjust the settings in the mod's menu
[*][b]Important[/b] this mod is designed to be run at 1920x1080 or higher.
[*]Please set your resolution to at least 1920x1080
[*]Go to Settings tab on Unity Mod Manager to set your screen width to at least 1920 wide
[/list]
[b]Usage

[/b]The mod provides the following tabs and here is a brief description of each of them:

[list]
[*][b]Bag of Tricks[/b]: this is a collection of quality of life, quick cheats, settings, multipliers, etc from the awesome Kingmaker mod of the same name plus a bag or two of new tricks ^_^
[*][b]Level Up & Multiclass[/b]: a variety of character creation, level up, unlock mythic paths plus support for multiple classes per level up and gestalt gameplay
[*][b]Party Editor[/b]: lets you edit almost any aspect of your character. Make sure you explore all the different disclosure toggles.  You can edit classes, stats, facts (feats and more), buffs, abilities, spells and spellbooks as well as the composition of your party
[*][b]Loot Coloring & Checklist[/b]: this lets you enable a loot grading and coloring system similar to Borderlands or Diablo.  It also gives you a screen where view all the items in an area that you have not looted yet.
[*][b]Enchantment[/b]: allows you to add or remove enchantments from the items in your inventory
[*][b]Search 'n Pick[/b]: this lets you search through all the available resources (items, feats, abilities, spells and many more) and manipulate your game state in an almost limitless set of ways.  You can add/remove items, feats, abilities, etc.  You can spawn any unit. You can start/unstart/complete etudes, quests, etc.  You can teleport to any area in the game.  It is almost unimaginable how much you can do in here so keep digging!
[*][b]Crusade[/b]: this allows you to edit various aspects of your crusade state.
[*][b]Armies[/b]: this allows you to edit the composition and stats of your armies
[*][b]Etudes[/b]: this is a new and exciting feature that allows you to see for the first time the structure and some basic relationships of [b][i]Etudes [/i][/b]and other [b][i]Elements[/i][/b] that control the progression of your game story. [b]Etudes [/b]are hierarchical in structure and additionally contain a set of [b]Elements [/b]that can both conditions to check and actions to execute when the etude is started. As you browe you will notice there is a disclosure triangle next to the name which will show the children of the Etude.  Etudes that have [b]Elements[/b] will offer a second disclosure triangle next to the status that will show them to you.
[b]WARNING[/b]: this tool can both miraculously fix your broken progression or it can break it even further. Save and back up your save before using. Remember that[i] "with great power comes great responsibility"[/i][*][b]Quest Resolution[/b]: this allows you to view your active quests and advance them as needed to work around bugs or skip quests you don't want to do.  Be warned this may break your game progression if used carelessly.
[/list]
[b]Guide to building a second class (and beyond) equal to your current and then multiclassing
[/b]Let's say your char is level 6 cleric and you want to make them also level 6 fighter.[list=1]
1 - turn off all multiclass selections2 - give yourself 1 levelup
3 - choose fighter and gain just that 1 level
4 - Party Editor > Char > Classes
5 - check gestalt on the cleric class (original class)
6 - you will automatically get a new level up marker
7 - level up Fighter until you can't anymore (second class)
8 - Now you have a 6 Cleric/6 fighter
9 - Choose which you want to be your main class
10 - mark the other one as gestalt in party editor
11 - on the multiclass config screen check that class as your multiclass option
12 - repeat this for as many extra classes as you want (until you lag the game)
13 - when done adjust your stats as desired to fit your playstyle in Party > Char > Stats (edited)
[/list][b]To gestalt Mythics[/b]. (Best time is right before you pick your path in Drezen
[list=1]
1 - Give yourself a mythic level in Toybox (To 3)
2 -Take one of the mythic paths you want to gestalt
3 - Go into the Toybox party tab, and set the path as Gestalt
4 - Repeat steps 2 & 3 for all but the last Mythic path you want (So if you want to be 2 paths, i.e. Angel/Azata, Lich/Demon, etc, skip this step)
5 - Lower your mythic level to 2 and then press the Set button on the mythic experience (Should set your Mythic Experience to 2)
6 - Pick your path like normal during the Drezen siege at the flag
7 - Only after completely every other step, go to the multiclass config, and set the multiclass config flags for the paths you set the Gestalt flags on in step 3
8 - (optional) In Toybox's party tab, under your characters spell tab, use the Merge button on the mythic spells books
[/list]Please feel free to make other enhancement requests [url=https://github.com/cabarius/ToyBox/issues]here[/url]﻿. 
Please tap new issue and mark it as an `enhancement`.
Please also file any bugs you find [url=https://github.com/cabarius/ToyBox/issues]here[/url]﻿.

Name: Turnbased Combat Delay
Author: Vek17
About: Allows you to alter the pause before turn based combat starts

VersionHistory.Changelog: Support for update 1.3.0

Description: Allows you to shorten the turn based combat delay

Name: Visual Adjustments 2
Author: Barley/Spacehamster
About: Successor to Visual Adjustments which allows adjusting character appearance. Built with an exclusively native UI, no more UMM!

VersionHistory.Changelog: >Fixed hide enchants again
>Fixed the "Hide Belt Items" Feature

>Fixed the "Hide" option for Enchant Overrides
>Fixed "Hide Class Equipment" option
Fixed the "Fix Scale" & the "Global buff profile" buttons.
>Fixed for game version 1.4.0y
Fixed it not working on the overworld map and when the doll UI would get stuck on the screen sometimes.

>Added an option to hide Mythic Visuals
>Fixed a bug where Per-Character Buff profiles wouldnt save.
>Fixed an issue where the "Fix Scale" button had inverted function (this also caused an issue where Drake companions from Expanded Content would be huge)
>Fixed an issue where the portrait picker would fail to function in certain circumstances.
>Fixed an issue where part of the doll UI would be superimposed over the rest of the UI under certain circumstances

Name: Weapon Focus Plus
Author: Vek17 & xoff
About: Weapon Focus Plus allows you to use fighter weapon group based weapon focus instead of picking a single weapon.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Updated to support new groups
Github release

Description: Allows you to use fighter weapon group based weapon focus instead of picking a single weapon.

Name: WotR Inventory Tweak (Quick Cast)
Author: Hambeard
About: This is the alpha release of Quick Cast (formally Inventory Tweaks). Installing and uninstalling does not break saves. This is an alpha, expect there to be bugs.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fixed Meta-magic not showing spells properly
* Fixed Meta-magic bug

* Adds tool tips
* Fixes Toybox color conflict
Fixed issue with pick up an item type for the first time displaying as if you do not have any of those items.
* Fixed bug where wrong spell casting from additional menu
* Added additional window will pop up on the left side of the window when main window is on right side of screen.

Version 0.1.1
* Redid the conversion/additional UI as spells like Shades takes up too much screen
* Add support for metamagic
* Bound min/max to ctrl-z
* Sorted Conversion spells by name
QuickCast
Fixes party not being updated at capital.
Fixes cantrips not casting.

Description: Pathfinder: WotR Inventory Tweak

Name: WotR Resource Unification
Author: pheonix99
About: It's a tool to merge different (game engine) instances of the same (tabletop rules) pool from different classes and make them behave correctly.

VersionHistory.Changelog: Fix for issue causing all mod affected resources to stop working.
Properly handles invalid guid input.

Added Arcanist Arcane Reservoir and Alchemist Bombs to the preloaded config.

Improved a lot of backend things.

Added reporting on what it's doing.

Tool to combine existing scaled-by-level resources across classes and use the best ability modifier where applicable.

Comes with config for Ki and Arcane pool.
